byline.contributor: Stephen Babcock reported from Baltimore, and John Corrales from New York.
byline.original: By STEPHEN BABCOCK and JOHN CORRALES

abstract: Baltimore Police Commissioner Anthony W Batts concedes that officers should have been quicker to summon medical attention for Freddie Gray, black man who died after sustaining spinal cord injury while in police custody.
lead_paragraph: The city’s police commissioner said Mr. Gray, who died of a spinal injury while in custody, should have received medical attention when he was first arrested, not 50 minutes later.

headline.main: Baltimore Police Admit Delay in Calling Ambulance for Freddie Gray
headline.print_headline: Call for Help Was Late, Police Admit in Baltimore

snippet: The city’s police commissioner said Mr. Gray, who died of a spinal injury while in custody, should have received medical attention when he was first arrested, not 50 minutes later.
